content.name: hostInitiator
content.description:
Information about host initiators in the storage system.

After you create a host configuration for controlling host access to storage on the system, you need to create a host initiator for each host configuration that accesses iSCSI or Fibre Channel (FC) storage. The initiator connects the host to the target iSCSI or FC node on the system.

Initiator-based registration allows you to register the initiator to a host without having to manage individual paths. By default, when an initiator is registered to a host, all of its paths, including those specified after the registration takes place, are automatically granted access to any storage provisioned for the host.

attributes.name: instanceId
attributes.description: Internal identifier of the hostInitiator instance.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the hostInitiator instance.

attributes.name: operationalStatus
attributes.description: Operational statuses of the host initiator.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: Health information for the host initiator, as defined by the health resource type.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Alias of the host to which the host initiator belongs.

attributes.name: initiatorId
attributes.description:
Host initiator name:
  • For an iSCSI initiator, this is the iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN).
  • For an FC initiator, this is the Worldwide Name (WWN).

attributes.name: parentHost
attributes.description: Information about the host to which the host initiator is assigned, as defined by the host resource type.

attributes.name: isIgnored
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the host initiator should be included when storage access is granted to the host. Values are:
  • true - Do not include the host initiator when storage is granted to the associated host.
  • false - Include the host initiator when storage is granted to the associated host.

attributes.name: nodeWWN
attributes.description: (Applies to FC initiators only.) Node Worldwide Name (WWN) of the initiator.

attributes.name: portWWN
attributes.description: (Applies to FC initiators only.) Port Worldwide Name (WWN) of the initiator.

attributes.name: chapUserName
attributes.description: (Applies to iSCSI initiators only.) CHAP user name. By default, this is the host initiator's iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN).

attributes.name: isChapSecretEnabled
attributes.description:
(Applies to iSCSI initiators only.) Indicates whether CHAP authentication is enabled for the host initiator. Values are:
  • true - CHAP authentication is enabled.
  • false - CHAP authentication is disabled.

attributes.name: paths
attributes.description: Host initiator paths, as defined by the hostInitiatorPath resource type.

attributes.name: iscsiType
attributes.description: (Applies to iSCSI initiators only.) iSCSI initiator type.

attributes.name: isBound
attributes.description:
(Applies to iSCSI initiators only.) Indicates whether the iSCSI initiator is bound to an IP address. This is only applicable to hardware-dependent adapter devices. Values are:
  • true - iSCSI initiator is bound to an IP address.
  • false - iSCSI initiator is not bound to an IP address.
